definition: a speech/to speak/to talk/to address/CL:個|个[ge4]
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: His talking is full of speculative thinking, it sounds quite logical.
sentences.chinese: 講話的思辨性極強，聽起來很有邏輯。

sentences.english: The left slice shows an area active during extemporaneous speech just posterior and adjacent to the tumor.
sentences.chinese: 左切片顯示面積活躍在即席講話只是後，毗鄰的腫瘤。

sentences.english: The motion that the remark of the last speaker be expunged from the record.
sentences.chinese: 該提議要求把最後一個發言的人的講話從記錄上除掉。

sentences.english: The sound spelled "miaow" is used only in talking to people.
sentences.chinese: 發出的“喵喵聲”只在與人講話時使用。

sentences.english: I 'm very excited to hear Dr. Gambol 's talk.
sentences.chinese: 我很興奮能聽到甘博博士講話。

sentences.english: He wasshowferedchauffeured away soon thereafter with no public statement.
sentences.chinese: 他沒對公衆發表講話就被車接走。
我現在講話都很時髦的。

sentences.english: Journalists are studying the minister's speech for pointers to the contents of next month's policy statement.
sentences.chinese: 記者們在研究部長講話以揣摩下月施政報告中的動向。

sentences.english: The motion that the remark of the last speaker (should) be expunged from the record.
sentences.chinese: 該提議要求把最後一個發言的人的講話從記錄上除掉。

sentences.english: We teed off the meeting with the chairman's speech.
sentences.chinese: 我們以主席的講話開始了此次會議。

sentences.english: He completely monopolized the conversation last night; Mary and I couldn't get a word in edgeways.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚滔滔不絕地講話，瑪麗和我完全插不上嘴。

sentences.english: It is bad manners to be absent-minded when other people talk to you.
sentences.chinese: 別人同你講話時出心不在焉是沒禮貌的。

sentences.english: It was really challenge to speak before so lare an audience.
sentences.chinese: 給那麼多的人講話對我來說的確是個挑戰。

sentences.english: I, unfortunately, will be going back to Washington after my remarks. Secretary Rod Paige and the Lt.
sentences.chinese: 非常抱歉，在講話結束之後，我將回到華盛頓。

sentences.english: He often talks on the radio.
The engineer interlarded his speech with many technical terms.
sentences.chinese: 這位工程師在他的講話中夾雜着許多術語。

definition: to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to make a speech/statement/utterance/CL:個|个[ge4]
lead/leading/to lead/leadership/leader/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
to talk (with sb)/to have a conversation/talk/conversation/CL:次[ci4]
dialogue/CL:個|个[ge4]
expression of opinion/views/remarks/arguments
to discuss/to talk over/CL:個|个[ge4]
to interview/to gather news/to hunt for and collect/to cover
to respond/response
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to refuse/to decline/to reject
voice/sound/CL:個|个[ge4]
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
to discuss/to converse/chat/discussion
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
